title: Zuckerberg to testify about Libra before U.S. House Financial Services Committee
text:
The Facebook CEO will answer questions about the firm’s impact on financial services and housing on October 23. This will be Zuckerberg’s first appearance before a U.S. congressional committee since April 2018. (Reuters)

Talking point: The news comes as global regulators heighten their scrutiny of Libra, Facebook’s proposed digital coin, and in the wake of leaked audio from an internal company meeting where Zuckerberg justified his refusal to appear at multiple international regulatory hearings. Facebook will likely face critical questions from the committee, whose Democratic chairwoman Maxine Waters has called on Facebook to abandon plans for the currency. It’s yet more scrutiny for the project; on Tuesday, two U.S. Senate Democrats wrote a letter to Libra Association members Visa, Mastercard and Stripe, asking them to reconsider their involvement, and the Bank of England warned Libra would face strict oversight in the U.K.
